name: razorman57
text: Wow. I think that that sets the record for most lamed out comments in a row. is that a good or bad thing? we may never know.

name: dracer2
text:
I'm not sure that it sets the record, but it is certainly a long run of lamed out comments, and all stemming from a little strip reference comment that I made - a comment, I note, that currently has 182 chubbies to its 3 lames. It is my most chubbied comment - the scene of my greatest victory - which is why I've chosen this strip to make the following proclamations.

Dear Assetbar: I feel that the default lamed out comment threshold should be proportional to chubbies. The general consensus on this comment is evidentially that it is chubby, and the greying out should reflect this. It just means one more if statement to not grey out if the chubbies are greater than the lames. I feel you can handle this.

Dear Assetbar Users: I find the following comments that you see everywhere to be lame, and intend to start marking them as such.

1. Comments that says things like "chubby for you" and don't add anything to the dialogue. You feel someone is chubby worthy? Then just give them a chubby, there's no need to take credit for it. People who provide a reason for their chubbies, like "chubbied for Venture Bros reference" or whatever are a grey area and will be assessed on a case by case basis. In most cases though I would find these comments to accomplish nothing aside from elongating the page, and therefore to be lame. If you lamed someone by accident when you intended to chubby them then there is likewise no need to comment apologising. Suck it up.

2. Comments that say "oh, perfect avatar sync" or "chubbied for your avatar." I find these lame because people can (and do) change their avatars, making the relevance of your comment fleeting at best.

3. I'm getting pretty sick of the things that are established in the later strips and then get parroted again and again in the early archives. "Philippe is five, he will always be five" springs to mind, but there's about a dozen... "Ray Smuckles gets things done", "Teodor is hung like a cranberry" et al... guys, unless it's actually relevant to the strip/discussion, these comments are lame.

name: paperboy_2000
text:
Ok, so they printed Ray's blog on the editorial page of the Australian Daily Telegraph? That is both awesome and disturbing.

The timing could probably be better for Chris. The web site will get a lot of first-time hits from Australian readers, and they'll be greeted by the sight of two cats rooting on the sofa and a Sidney Yamahata/ Goth LOLcat 2-fer.

Welcome, Aussies! It ain't Garfield.

name: aperson
text: Hey , well spotted!

name: principal_buttsavage
text: Funny. The subject is lolcats, and Roast Beef specifically wonders if there is "SOMETHING AWFUL" on the news.

name: straw
text:
Dear ROAST BEEF,

I am deeply sorry that I MADE YOU A LOLCAT AND PUT YOU ON THE NIGHTLY NEWS. I know it was my fault. I never meant for that to happen. I never dreamed it could.

I am also sorry that A GUY PUT YOU ON HIS WEBPAGE and that THAT A LOT OF PEOPLE ARE LOOKING AT for a little while. I hope you feel the same way.

I mean this. I mean every word.
RAY!

name: puguglypress
text: P.S. If you accept my apology, please call me at COME ON BEEF WE BEEN DOGGS SINCE SMALL TIMES so we can work this out.

name: tekende
text:
Half the fun is the moment of insertion.

25% is what leads up to it (undressing, foreplay, etc.). 10% is what happens between insertion and coitus.

15% is coitus.

Percentages may vary by person.

Or was, anyway. At least he's got a new mental image to use for stalling.
